results.title: Landscape
results.creator_credit: Anna Szepesi, Tamas Waliczky and ZKM Institut fur Bildmedien, Karlsruhe
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: In a small German village, time stops in the middle of a storm. Raindrops glitter frozen in the air, and the only living thing is the roving eye of the camera which moves through this frozen moment of time. Using complex digital animation techniques, Tamas Waliczky invites the viewer to reimagine how time and space are perceived and proposes a new virtual experience of the body’s movement through space.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anna Szepesi, Tamas Waliczky and ZKM Institut fur Bildmedien, Karlsruhe

results.title: A Personal search
results.brief_description: In this autobiographical documentary, John Whitney, one of the best-known film and computer artists of our time, reflects on and explores his lifelong search for the complentarity of music and visual art, and the synthesis of film and computer technologies. In doing so, he describes current developments that foretell radical and exciting new ways viewers will soon be experiencing music and art.
results.description: In this autobiographical documentary, John Whitney, one of the best-known film and computer artists of our time, reflects on and explores his lifelong search for the complentarity of music and visual art, and the synthesis of film and computer technologies. group_siblings.title: Experiments in motion graphics
group_siblings.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio

results.title: Permutations
results.brief_description:
An early example of computer generated animation; several hundred dots move about the screen according to a set of
instructions in a graphics program which were input into a
IBM digital computer and coloured by an optical printer.
‘Action sequences, proceeding from order to disorder and back to ordered patterning, suggest a parallel to harmonic phenomena of the musical scale … The effect is to subtly generate and resolve tension - which is similar to the primary emotional power of music composition’ (John Whitney).

results.title: Matrix
results.brief_description: Another of John Whitney’s important investigations into technology and the moving image, this particularly geometric animated abstraction uses industrial computers to render Whitney’s light musical forms onto the screen. Computer generated forms evolve, merge and subdivide on a black background, each motion and movement as carefully orchestrated and synthesised as the accompanying music.
results.description: Another of John Whitney’s important investigations into technology and the moving image, this particularly geometric animated abstraction uses industrial computers to render Whitney’s light musical forms onto the screen. results.title: Experiments in motion graphics
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In this documentary film exploring his working processes, John Whitney explains some of the techniques and philosophies involved in programming and animating his computer-made abstract films. He attempts to define his new art of ‘motion graphics’ by comparison with music and language. As well as an intriguing investigation into his work, this film is a visual feast of his remarkable dynamic abstractions.

group_works.title: I Don't want to be a bludger

results.title: Forced into images
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour, silent
results.brief_description: In Destiny Deacon’s photographic series Forced into Images (a title taken from a poem by Alice Walker), a dramatic narrative unfolds that follows a girl’s troubled life from birth to womanhood. Deacon’s work often explores cultural stereotyping, domestic violence and the status of Indigenous women.

constellations_other.name: Women in charge
constellations_other.description: Across documentary, film, TV, and visual art, Aboriginal women have led how they will be represented on-screen.

results.description: DESTINY DEACON has shown in exhibitions including the 2001 Yokohama Triennale, Das Lied von der Erde at the Museum Fridericianum in Kassel, the 2000 Biennale of Sydney and the 1995 Havana Biennial and the Yokohoma triennial. Using people and objects close to her - friends and family, dolls and other toys - the artist creates strange, unsettling images that address some of the most difficult aspects of contemporary Australian life. Cultural stereotyping, domestic violence and the status of Aboriginal women all inform Deacon’s photography, and her gift for storytelling and biting sense of humour provide her work with a compelling edge. With her photographic series Forced into Images (a title taken from a poem by Alice Walker), a dramatic narrative unfolds, following a girl’s troubled life from birth to womanhood.
description_for_label: DESTINY DEACON has shown in exhibitions including the 2001 Yokohama Triennale, Das Lied von der Erde at the Museum Fridericianum in Kassel, the 2000 Biennale of Sydney and the 1995 Havana Biennial and the Yokohoma triennial. Using people and objects close to her - friends and family, dolls and other toys - the artist creates strange, unsettling images that address some of the most difficult aspects of contemporary Australian life. Cultural stereotyping, domestic violence and the status of Aboriginal women all inform Deacon’s photography, and her gift for storytelling and biting sense of humour provide her work with a compelling edge. With her photographic series Forced into Images (a title taken from a poem by Alice Walker), a dramatic narrative unfolds, following a girl’s troubled life from birth to womanhood.
